metadata.label: run
metadata.description: Executes the agent for a given user query.

tools.name: set
tools.description: The `Client.get()` function can be used to send HTTP GET requests to HTTP endpoints.

agent.systemPrompt: {role: "Math tutor", instructions: "Help the students with their questions."}

codedata.sourceCode: string result = check agent->run("What is the sum of 1 and 2?");

metadata.label: System Prompt
metadata.description: The system prompt assigned to the agent

systemPrompt.value: {role: "Math tutor", instructions: "Help the students with their questions."}

metadata.description: The model used by the agent

metadata.description: The maximum number of iterations the agent performs to complete the task

metadata.description: Specifies whether verbose logging is enabled

metadata.description: Define the agent's primary function

role.placeholder: e.g., Customer Support Assistant, Sales Advisor, Data Analyst

metadata.description: Detailed instructions for the agent

instructions.placeholder: e.g., You are a friendly assistant. Your goal is to...

metadata.description: The HTTP client provides functionality to connect to remote HTTP services and perform requests using standard HTTP methods like GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, etc.

metadata.label: Url
metadata.description: URL of the target service

metadata.label: HTTP Version
metadata.description: HTTP protocol version supported by the client

metadata.label: HTTP1 Settings
metadata.description: HTTP/1.x specific settings

metadata.label: HTTP2 Settings
metadata.description: HTTP/2 specific settings

metadata.label: Timeout
metadata.description: Maximum time(in seconds) to wait for a response before the request times out

metadata.label: Forwarded
metadata.description: The choice of setting `Forwarded`/`X-Forwarded-For` header, when acting as a proxy

metadata.label: Follow Redirects
metadata.description: HTTP redirect handling configurations (with 3xx status codes)

metadata.label: Pool Config
metadata.description: Configurations associated with the request connection pool

metadata.label: Cache
metadata.description: HTTP response caching related configurations

metadata.label: Compression
metadata.description: Enable request/response compression (using `accept-encoding` header)

metadata.label: Auth
metadata.description: Client authentication options (Basic, Bearer token, OAuth, etc.)

metadata.label: Circuit Breaker
metadata.description: Circuit breaker configurations to prevent cascading failures

metadata.label: Retry Config
metadata.description: Automatic retry settings for failed requests

metadata.label: Cookie Config
metadata.description: Cookie handling settings for session management

metadata.label: Response Limits
metadata.description: Limits for response size and headers (to prevent memory issues)

metadata.label: Proxy
metadata.description: Proxy server settings if requests need to go through a proxy

metadata.label: Validation
metadata.description: Enable automatic payload validation for request/response data against constraints

metadata.label: Socket Config
metadata.description: Low-level socket settings (timeouts, buffer sizes, etc.)

metadata.label: Lax Data Binding
metadata.description:
Enable relaxed data binding on the client side.
When enabled:
- `null` values in JSON are allowed to be mapped to optional fields
- missing fields in JSON are allowed to be mapped as `null` values

metadata.label: Class
metadata.description: AzureOpenAiProvider is a client class that provides an interface for interacting with Azure-hosted OpenAI language models.

codedata.sourceCode: ai:AzureOpenAiProvider myModel = check new (serviceUrl, apiKey, deploymentId, apiVersion);

metadata.label: Service URL
metadata.description: The base URL of Azure OpenAI API endpoint

metadata.label: API Key
metadata.description: The Azure OpenAI API key

metadata.label: Deployment ID
metadata.description: The deployment identifier for the specific model deployment in Azure

metadata.label: API Version
metadata.description: The Azure OpenAI API version (e.g., "2023-07-01-preview")

metadata.label: Maximum Tokens
metadata.description: The upper limit for the number of tokens in the response generated by the model

metadata.label: Temperature
metadata.description: The temperature for controlling randomness in the model's output

metadata.label: HTTP Version
metadata.description: The HTTP version understood by the client

metadata.label: HTTP1 Settings
metadata.description: Configurations related to HTTP/1.x protocol

metadata.label: HTTP2 Settings
metadata.description: Configurations related to HTTP/2 protocol

metadata.label: Timeout
metadata.description: The maximum time to wait (in seconds) for a response before closing the connection

metadata.label: Forwarded
metadata.description: The choice of setting `forwarded`/`x-forwarded` header

metadata.label: Pool Configuration
metadata.description: Configurations associated with request pooling

metadata.label: Cache Configuration
metadata.description: HTTP caching related configurations

metadata.label: Compression
metadata.description: Specifies the way of handling compression (`accept-encoding`) header

metadata.label: Circuit Breaker Configuration
metadata.description: Configurations associated with the behaviour of the Circuit Breaker

metadata.label: Retry Configuration
metadata.description: Configurations associated with retrying

metadata.label: Response Limit Configuration
metadata.description: Configurations associated with inbound response size limits

metadata.label: Secure Socket Configuration
metadata.description: SSL/TLS-related options

metadata.label: Proxy Configuration
metadata.description: Proxy server related options

metadata.label: Payload Validation
metadata.description: Enables the inbound payload validation functionality which provided by the constraint package. Enabled by default

metadata.description: Terminate on error

metadata.label: New Connection
metadata.description:
Ballerina Redis connector provides the capability to access Redis cache.
This connector lets you to perform operations to access and manipulate key-value data stored in a Redis database.

metadata.label: Connection Type
metadata.description: Connection configurations of the Redis server. This can be either a single URI or a set of parameters

metadata.label: Connection Pooling Enabled
metadata.description: Flag to indicate whether connection pooling is enabled

metadata.label: Cluster Mode Enabled
metadata.description: Flag to indicate whether the connection is a cluster connection

metadata.description: Configurations related to SSL/TLS encryption
